timeline.body:
I'd like to have some JavaDoc here (or some documentation somewhere else) on how the `ModifiableValue` is actually persisted. What is the format to specify a modifiable in a prefab?

From looking at the code it seems like the value is persisted as "unlabeled" array:

```
"<field_name>": [<base_value>, <pre_modifier>, <multiplier>, <post_modifier>]
```

I don't think this is very intuitive, and when seeing this in a prefab I'd think of a vector or list but not of a special data class 🙈

timeline.body:
I'm wondering whether it would make sense to check an `else if` here for a single number. That would allow to easily specify the base value in a prefab without worrying about all the modifiers. So you could either do 

```jsonc
"myValue": 7,					// base value only
// ... or ...
"otherValaue": [3, 0, 0.9, 2]	// base and modifiers/multiplier
```
